trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with CloudBees | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with CloudBees | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use CloudBees with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use CloudBees with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and CloudBees.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and CloudBees.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A CloudBees tenant
trans-unit.target: A CloudBees tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to CloudBees will be able to single sign into the application at your CloudBees company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to CloudBees will be able to single sign into the application at your CloudBees company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for CloudBees
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for CloudBees

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for CloudBees.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for CloudBees.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type CloudBees.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type CloudBees.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select CloudBees, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select CloudBees, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cloudbees</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cloudbees</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to CloudBees with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to CloudBees with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for CloudBees requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for CloudBees requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the CloudBees application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the CloudBees application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to CloudBees page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to CloudBees page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the CloudBees Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your user to sign in to CoudBees (e.g.: https://grandcentral.cloudbees.com/login", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the CloudBees Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your user to sign in to CoudBees (e.g.: https://grandcentral.cloudbees.com/login", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at CloudBees page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at CloudBees page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your CloudBees company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your CloudBees company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the SSO integration tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SSO integration tab.

trans-unit.source: In the Set Up SAML 2.0 Single Sign On section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Set Up SAML 2.0 Single Sign On section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudBees page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Remote login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudBees page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Remote login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Existing certificate fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Existing certificate fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication domains textbox, type your company’s domain.
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication domains textbox, type your company’s domain.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into CloudBees, they must be provisioned into CloudBees.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into CloudBees, they must be provisioned into CloudBees.

trans-unit.source: In the case of CloudBees, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of CloudBees, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your CloudBees company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your CloudBees company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Edit Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to Edit Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Email, First Name, Last Name and other attributes of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Email, First Name, Last Name and other attributes of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click Add User.

trans-unit.source: An email with login instructions will be send to the owner of the account.
trans-unit.target: An email with login instructions will be send to the owner of the account.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other CloudBees user account creation tools or APIs provided by CloudBees to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other CloudBees user account creation tools or APIs provided by CloudBees to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the CloudBees application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the CloudBees application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
